DataElement.preferredName: Cell Specimen 5 Milliliter Vial Collection Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to represent the number of 5 milliliter cell specimen vials collected.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to collection vials of cell specimens._A number with no fractional part.::5_A small, often stoppered glass or plastic bottle for holding medicines and chemicals._A measure of volume for a liquid.  A milliliter is approximately 950 times smaller than a quart and 30 times smaller than a fluid ounce.  A milliliter of liquid and a cubic centimeter (cc) of liquid are the same._A small, often stoppered glass or plastic bottle for holding medicines and chemicals.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid. Cells are highly variable and specialized in both structure and function, though all must at some stage replicate proteins and nucleic acids, utilize energy, and reproduce themselves.:Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.

Concepts.definition: The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: A number with no fractional part.::5:A measure of volume for a liquid.  A milliliter is approximately 950 times smaller than a quart and 30 times smaller than a fluid ounce.  A milliliter of liquid and a cubic centimeter (cc) of liquid are the same.:A small, often stoppered glass or plastic bottle for holding medicines and chemicals.:The act of gathering something together.

Concepts.definition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A unit of volume equal to one millionth (10E-6) of a cubic meter, one thousandth of a liter, one cubic centimeter, or 0.061023 7 cubic inch. A cubic centimeter is the CGS unit of volume.
A small, often stoppered glass or plastic bottle for holding fluids.
The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The quantity of the specified item.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

Concepts.definition: Determining the number or amount of something.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/11/17 tt transferred context, added reg status and CSI per Round 5 finalization task.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support Duke University adoption of C3D.
